title: Introduction to C++: What is C++ and its uses?

questions.text: Which of the following best describes C++?
questions.explanation: C++ is a compiled language, meaning the code is translated into machine code before execution. It's general-purpose, suitable for various applications.

questions.text: Write a C++ program that prints "Hello, world!" to the console.
questions.explanation: This code includes the iostream library for input/output operations. The main function is the entry point of the program, printing the message and returning 0 to indicate successful execution.

questions.text: Explain the difference between procedural programming and object-oriented programming in the context of C++.
questions.answer: Procedural programming focuses on procedures or functions that operate on data. Object-oriented programming organizes data and functions into objects, encapsulating data and methods that act upon that data. C++ supports both paradigms, allowing for flexibility in programming style.
questions.explanation: A good answer should highlight the key differences: procedures vs. objects, data encapsulation, and the benefits of each approach.  Mentioning C++'s support for both is crucial.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a common use case for C++?
questions.explanation: While C++ can be used for back-end web development (servers), it's less common for front-end development which typically uses languages like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

questions.text: Write a C++ function that takes two integers as input and returns their sum.
questions.answer: int sum(int a, int b) {  return a + b;}
questions.explanation: This function defines a simple addition operation. It takes two integer arguments and returns their sum.  The test cases demonstrate the function's correctness with both positive and negative numbers.
